title.rendered: Visit Egypt with Call a Jet – Travel Diary By Joe Kurta

content.rendered:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]My wife, our daughter and I just got back from this beautiful country which is awaiting you with so many amazing temples, pyramids, museums, the beautiful Nile river, friendly people and sandy beaches with great dive and snorkeling spots. After 2 weeks in Egypt, I have to admit that we fell in love with this country and wanted to go back to explore more.[/vc_column_text][vc_single_image media=”22898″ media_width_percent=”100″ uncode_shortcode_id=”114712″][vc_column_text]As it is NOW the perfect time to visit Egypt, we put together some ideas for you. The weather is not too hot, pleasant 25-29 degrees and there are only a few tourists which give you the chance to have the Pyramids of Giza almost to yourself.

Experience brand new luxury hotels, personal guided tours and if you wish our VIP Service in the background, fly privately and let us arrange all domestic flights within Egypt on a new King Air 200 from a reliable Call a Jet partner as well. Egypt has so much to offer that you need to pick your sightseeing spots wisely. The amazing Tour guide for Cairo is Maha. She knows everything and she is very funny. We strongly recommend her and her driver.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]

Day 1

  • Pyramids of Giza
  • Camel ride around the pyramids (after some time alone)
  • Great Sphinx of Giza
  • Lunch with a view of the pyramids
  • Drive back to the hotel (experience Cairo traffic and scenery)
  • Relax at the hotel

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_single_image media=”22908″ media_width_percent=”100″ uncode_shortcode_id=”791386″][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_single_image media=”22918″ media_width_percent=”100″ uncode_shortcode_id=”160593″][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]

Day 2

  • Breakfast at the hotel
  • Pick up: guide (Maha) and the driver
  • Drive to hanging church (Coptic church)
  • Egyptian Museum
  • Lunch (Kusheri restaurant with only one dish)
  • Back to the hotel/spa/swimming pool

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]

Day 3

  • Breakfast at the hotel
  • Pick up: guide (Maha) and the driver
  • Drive outside to Pyramid of Djoser
  • Drive back to the town
  • Exploring Mosque of Muhammad Ali
  • Drive back to the hotel
  • Exploring on foot Zamalek, buy high-quality Egyptian cotton bed linen

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_single_image media=”22913″ media_width_percent=”100″ uncode_shortcode_id=”332165″][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_single_image media=”22943″ media_width_percent=”100″ uncode_shortcode_id=”339041″][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]

Day 4

  • Flight to Aswan
  • Check-in at Sofitel Legend Old Cataract Hotel
  • Relax at the pool

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]

Day 5-7

  • Private boat trip around Elephantine island and quick sightseeing in Nubian Village
  • Temple of Philae
  • Kalabsha Temple
  • Tempel of Abu Simbel (3-4 hours trip by car or King Air 200 charter)

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_single_image media=”22948″ media_width_percent=”100″ uncode_shortcode_id=”544853″][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_single_image media=”22933″ media_width_percent=”100″ uncode_shortcode_id=”482464″][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]

Day 7-11

  • Cruise from Aswan to Luxor (private boat or luxury boat for 50 guests)
  • Temple of Kom Ombo and Temple of Edfu

Or by car with a guide and personal driver (faster)

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]

Day 11-14

  • Valley of the Kings
  • Karnak Temple
  • First Pylon Temple
  • Temple of Ramses III
  • Temple of Dendera
  • Temple of Seti I

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_single_image media=”22953″ media_width_percent=”100″ uncode_shortcode_id=”592580″][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_single_image media=”22958″ media_width_percent=”100″ uncode_shortcode_id=”477140″][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]

Day 14 –

  • Limousine transfer to Hurghada
  • Stay at Rixos Premium Magawish Suites & Villas Resort

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]Visit Egypt with Call a Jet! [/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

excerpt.rendered:
My wife, our daughter and I just got back from this beautiful country which is awaiting you with so many amazing temples, pyramids, museums, the beautiful Nile river, friendly people and sandy beaches with great dive and snorkeling spots.
After 2 weeks in Egypt, I have to admit that we fell in love with this country and wanted to go back to explore more.
